channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Election a Referendum on Dems' Abuse of Justice System
Trump turns conviction into cash, spotlights record fundraising in wake of guilty verdict
item.description: Trump campaign announces haul of $52.8 million in fundraising in the 24 hours after the former president was found guilty on all counts in his criminal trial.

item.title: Biden Faces Big Trouble in Virginia
item.description: States previously considered out of reach for former President Trump may now be in play. One of the most intriguing is Virginia.

item.title: Kansas Constitution doesn't include right to vote: state high court majority
item.description: The Kansas Supreme Court released a majority opinion Friday suggesting that the state Constitution's Bill of Rights does not include a right to vote.

item.title: Can Biden Seize the Lifeline This Verdict Gives Him?
item.description: The incumbent president is badly behind - but now he has a chance to woo disenchanted Republicans who can't bear Donald's stink says Guardian columnist Jonathan Freedland

item.title: Vermont Gov. Scott vetoes 'safe injection site' proposal
item.description: Republican Vermont Gov. Phil Scott has vetoed the Democratic Legislature's proposal to create a pilot "safe injection site" for drug users in Burlington.

item.title: The Case for Bernie Sanders Retiring From the Senate
item.description: To suggest every older candidate or public servant retire would be rank ageism. But Ibelieve Sanders had an opportunity here to set an important example.

item.title: GOP's Murkowski laments Trump's 'baggage' following guilty verdict
item.description: Sen. Lisa Murkowski, R-Alaska, was one of the last Republicans to comment on former President Trump's conviction, but did not reveal her thoughts on it.

item.title: Maine Issuing Licenses to Individuals With Bogus SSNs
item.description: A police department in southern Maine is seeing an uptick in the number of driver's licenses issued by the Bureau of Motor Vehicles (BMV) to individuals using the social security number 999-99-9999. We've seen an uptick in [BMV] using 999-99-9999 for social security numbers, wrote Darcie L. Valido, the Assistant Director of Operations for Sanford

item.title: Soros heir urges Democrats to hammer Trump as 'convicted felon at every opportunity'
item.description: George Soros' son urged Democrats to wield Trump's conviction against him, constantly referring to him as a "convicted felon," ahead of the election.
